business.headline: Bajaj Housing Finance shares hit upper circuit after bumper listing: What's next?Bajaj Housing Finance listing: By midday, the shares hit an upper circuit at Rs 164.99, representing an overall premium of 135.70% over the IPO price.

'Can afford, but won't buy': Edelweiss MF CEO on not owning luxury carsEdelweiss MF Radhika Gupta CEO currently owns an Innova, which is known for its practicality and reliability rather than for being a luxury car.

From branch manager to CEO: How Atul Jain transformed Bajaj Housing FinanceAtul Jain, now 52, has been with the Bajaj Group for over two decades. He began his career in investment banking, working as a project executive at PNB Capital Services Limited and later at Prudential Capital Markets Limited.

Bajaj Housing Finance shares list at 114% premium. What should investors do? With Bajaj Housing Finance shares debuting at a staggering 114% premium, investors face a pivotal choice: lock in profits now or stay the course for potential long-term rewards. Find out what experts suggest for your next move.
Kross shares list flat on D-Street: Should you book profit or hold? Kross listing: Shares of Kross made a flat debut opening at Rs 240 on NSE and BSE, the same as its IPO price.

Bajaj Housing Finance turns multibagger on listing: Book profits or hold?Bajaj Housing Finance IPO listing: With this blockbuster entry on Dalal Street, the key dilemma for investors is now whether to book profits immediately or hold onto their positions for long-term gains.
Sensex, Nifty rally as Fed rate cut looms; markets stay bullishThe S&P BSE Sensex added 169.53 points to 83,060.47, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 62.55 points to 25,419.05

Bajaj Housing Finance makes bumper debut as shares list at 114% premiumBajaj Housing Finance listing: The shares were allocated to successful bidders on September 13, and the listing gains of Rs 80 per share slightly exceeded the grey market premium (GMP).

Gold, silver price today, September 16, 2024: Precious metals record hike on MCXGold Price Today September 16, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the higher side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Monday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Amazon, Flipkart and major smartphone brands face antitrust heat: ReportThe Competition Commission of India (CCI) has found that these companies have been involved in exclusive product launches on their platforms, which may have restricted competition and harmed smaller businesses.

Rent vs buy: What's the smarter financial move for you?Renting offers the freedom to move, explore career opportunities, and invest in other ventures. Buying a home, on the other hand, offers long-term security, a sense of ownership, and equity building.

Centre approves Madhya Pradesh's request for soybean procurement at MSPUnion Agriculture and Farmer Welfare Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan confirmed that the proposal from the Madhya Pradesh government was received and approved late Tuesday.

Centre lifts minimum export price cap on onion, basmati riceThe $950 per tonne minimum export price for basmati rice has been removed while the export duty on onion has been cut to 20 per cent from 40 per cent, in effect from September 14.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: Will it double investors' wealth on market debut?Bajaj Housing Finance IPO listing: With the GMP indicating a significant upside, all eyes are now on whether the shares will live up to the hype and deliver the bumper listing gains many expect.

Trump allies plan to privatise Fannie and Freddie, says reportThe discussions involve prominent figures close to Trump, including Larry Kudlow, the former director of the National Economic Council, and John McEntee, who previously worked in the White House.

Sebi chief addresses conflict of interest allegations with 3 big clarificationsThe Buchs firmly denied any wrongdoing, offering detailed explanations to counter allegations tied to consulting roles, rental income, and Madhabi Puri Buch's ICICI Bank stock options.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as markets take breather after strong rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 135.83 points to 82,926.88, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 43 points lower at 25,345.90.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: Cash in on listing day or wait for long-term gain? Brokerages tracking the IPO have already indicated that the IPO is set for a positive listing, with the grey market premium (GMP) indicating that investors will see their money double on listing day.

Sebi chief, husband reject conflict of interest charges, call it false, motivatedIn a joint statement, Sebi chief Madhabi Puri Buch and husband Dhaval Buch rejected recent allegations of conflict of interest as "false, malicious, and defamatory."

Bajaj Finance, Bajaj Finserv shares gain amid housing unit IPO buzzThe buzz around the Bajaj Housing Finance IPO, which is set to make its stock market debut on September 16, has led traders on Dalal Street to snap up shares of other publicly traded Bajaj companies, hoping to capitalise on the momentum.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Mamata Banerjee's 'fifth and final' invite to protesting doctors for talks todayThe protesting doctors will decide if they accept Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's invitation after a general body meeting.

Centre deliberating on adding caste column to census, no decision yet: SourcesThe government is considering to include a caste column in the next census. Parties across the political spectrum have been demanding a caste census.
Who will be next Delhi Chief Minister? Top AAP leaders meet Arvind KejriwalArvind Kejriwal dropped a bombshell on Sunday, announcing that he would resign in the next two days.

Trump safe after 'attempted assassination' at Florida golf club, suspect arrestedDonald Trump was reportedly golfing at the course when the gunshots took place. The Secret Service agents then escorted him to a holding room at the club.

Pics: Siddharth can't stop smiling as Aditi Rao makes her bridal entryAditi Rao Hydari's bridal entry was straight out of a movie scene. Siddharth couldn't stop smiling when he saw her for the first time at the wedding venue.

Fake news: Railways fact-checks Trinamool MP alleging 50% hike in Vande Bharat costsIn response to Gokhale's claim, the Ministry of Railways clarified that the total cost of a train is calculated by multiplying the cost per coach by the number of coaches.

No one is even trying to assassinate...: Elon Musk on Trump Florida shooting In a post on X, tech billionaire Elon Musk made a controversial statement targeting the Biden-Harris administration and questioned why no one is trying to assassinate US President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris.

Video explainer on dramatic Baramulla anti-terror op captured in drone footageThree terrorists were killed on Saturday following an overnight gunbattle with security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla district, officials said, terming it as a "significant success" ahead of the assembly elections. In a video of the encounter, captured on a drone, one of the three terrorists can be seen running out of the building in a bid to escape. However, security personnel opened fire on him, following which he was shot dead. The Union Territory is witnessing an increase in terrorist attacks over the past few weeks ahead of Assembly polls there.

Shogun star Anna Sawai becomes first Asian woman to win Best Actress EmmyAnna Sawai won the Emmy for Best Actress in a Drama for her role in Shogun, making her the first actor of Asian descent to achieve this honour. She expressed gratitude to her cast and crew, especially co-star Hiroyuki Sanada.

Phones, knives found in Bengaluru jail where actor Darshan was given VIP treatmentThe police raid comes after a photo of actor and murder accused Darshan Thoogudeepa chilling out with a gangster, Wilson Garden Naga, inside a prison went viral on social media.

Kolkata cop tried to save rape accused, got victim's body cremated in haste: CBIThe CBI has alleged that senior Kolkata cop Abhijit Mondal tried to protect RG Kar hospital rape-murder accused Sanjoy Roy, and got the trainee doctor's body hurriedly cremated.

Who is Ryan Routh, Ukraine supporter arrested for shooting at Trump in FloridaThe alleged gunman, whom authorities have identified as 58-year-old Ryan Wesley Routh, earlier on social media stated that "democracy is on the ballot" this year and "we cannot lose."

Aishwarya Rai wins Best Actress at SIIMA 2024, Aaradhya turns photographerAishwarya Rai Bachchan and daughter Aaradhya Bachchan wore blingy outfits at SIIMA 2024, held in Dubai. The actor won the Critics award for her performance as Nandini in Ponniyin Selvan: Part 2.

Vande Metro train renamed as Namo Bharat Rapid Rail: SourcesPrime Minister Narendra Modi will flag off the country's first Namo Bharat Rapid Rail today. According to the Railway Ministry, the train will enhance connectivity between Bhuj to Ahmedabad and will cover 359 km in nearly six hours.

Who will succeed Arvind Kejriwal as Delhi Chief Minister? Top contendersAs Arvind Kejriwal surprisingly announced his decision to resign as Delhi Chief Minister, here are some of the possible contenders for the top post.

Dushyant Chautala's mother likens rebel Anoop Dhanak, who joined BJP, to 'snake'Elected as a JJP candidate in the 2019 Haryana Assembly elections, Dhanak served as a Minister of State in the coalition government between the JJP and BJP.

The financial burden of a rare genetic disorder in India​The high cost and limited availability of treatment are still major challenges for patients with a rare genetic disorder called spinal muscular atrophy.
iOS 18 to start rolling out today: Here is what you should do before installingiOS 18 is all set to come to India today. Here is how you can prepare your device for the installation.

Kolkata rape: Ex-RG Kar principal tried to deceive investigators, says CBIThe forensic report of the polygraph test of Dr Sandip Ghosh, former RG Kar hospital principal, has revealed that he deliberately tried to deceive the CBI investigators. The report was mentioned in the federal agency's remand note that was exclusively accessed by India Today.

Bengaluru professor's reaction after students play a prank on him is viral. VideoA group of students of Bengaluru's Christ University decided to play a prank on their professor. His reaction has gone viral on Instagram.

sports.headline: France midfielder Adrien Rabiot set to join Marseille as free agentAdrien Rabiot is set to join Marseille, having agreed to a deal in principle after leaving Juventus. The French midfielder's return to Ligue 1 marks a significant move for the club, pending a medical examination.

OTD in 2011: Dravid played his final ODI, Kohli scored 1st hundred on English soilOn this day in 2011, Rahul Dravid played his final ODI innings for India during the 5th match of the series against England in Cardiff. In the same match, Kohli scored his first-ever hundred on English soil.

Ravi Shastri organised karaoke night after 36-all out in Adelaide: R AshwinOff-spinner R Ashwin recalled how Ravi Shastri helped improve the morale in the Indian dressing room after they lost to Australia in Adelaide in 2020. India were bundled out for 36, their lowest total in Test cricket history. However, India bounced back from that defeat and won the series 2-1.

IND vs BAN: Sunil Gavaskar's stern message for hosts: 'Can't put their guard down'Legendary India batter Sunil Gavaskar has sent a stern message for Indian cricket team ahead of the two-match Test series against Bangladesh beginning from September 19.

Sri Lanka announce 16-member squad for home Test series vs New ZealandSri Lanka announced a 16-member squad for the home Test series against New Zealand. The hosts showcased faith in the youngsters, who were brilliant in their performances against England.

England continue to be cautious as Jofra Archer returns to ODIs after 18 months England vs Australia: Jofra Archer will not feature in all five ODIs against Australia as the team management will continue to manage his workload. England and Australia will meet in a five-match series from September 19 to 29. It marks Archer's return to the 50-over format after 18 months.

The club condemned the abuse and expressed its "full support" for the Portugal left-back on Sunday.

R Ashwin picks Jasprit Bumrah as most valuable Indian cricketer over Rohit-KohliStar India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has picked Jasprit Bumrah as India's most valuable currently. Bumrah has been in phenomenal form across formats ever since his comeback in 2022.

ISL: Punjab FC clinch stoppage-time thriller vs Kerala BlastersTwo stoppage time goals, one each from Kerala Blasters and Punjab FC saw a thrilling finish to the game in the clubs' opener in the Indian Super League on Sunday, September 15. Punjab FC eked out a 2-1 win over Kerala.

England Women make history with landmark T20I against IrelandIRE vs ENG: England Women played their 600th match in limited-overs cricket, but ended up losing by five wickets at the Castle Avenue in Dublin.

Phil Salt enjoying 'added responsibility' as England T20I skipperENG vs AUS: Phil Salt said that he enjoyed captaining England in the T20I series against Australia. On Sunday, the Manchester T20I was abadoned due to rain without a ball being bowled.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
